definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
mutually shirking responsibilities (idiom); each blaming the other/passing the buck to and fro/each trying to unload responsibilities onto the other

sentences.english: The CrossCorrelation is an essential means of getting disturbing industrial frequency.
sentences.chinese: 互相關函數是確定工頻干擾噪聲頻率的一個重要手段。

sentences.english: The kitchen is unperceived in a white lacquer and stainless steel orthogonal form.
sentences.chinese: 廚房是白色的漆和互相垂直的不鏽鋼。

sentences.english: The SafeHouse is a place for people of different faiths to share and support each other.
sentences.chinese: 是一個讓來自不同信仰的人士分享及互相支持的天地。

sentences.english: At that time, England was in a Bible war between two English translations.
sentences.chinese: 當時，英國有兩版英譯《聖經》，互相不服氣。

sentences.english: You ever hear white people callin' each other honky all the time?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時辰聽過白人互相等號“白鬼”嗎，兄弟？

sentences.english: The two brothers quickly came to blows during their quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 這倆兄弟互相爭吵，很快就變成了拳腳相加。

sentences.english: Today, along with the advancement of globalization, it is pointless and makes no sense for countries to blame eath other.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟全球話的今天，國家間互相指責是無濟於事的。

sentences.english: Thanks to mutual supervision, we are successful finally.
sentences.chinese: 由於互相監督，我們最終成功了。

sentences.english: The resource owner and requestor do not foreknow each other.
sentences.chinese: 資源的擁有者和請求者一般互相不知道。

sentences.english: To jump over in or as if in leapfrog.
sentences.chinese: 就象跳背遊戲中互相跳過。

sentences.english: We are all Japanese. We all need to help each other.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是日本人，因此需要互相幫助。

sentences.english: The embarrassment for the government-and the delight of everybody else-remained.
sentences.chinese: 所以政府的尷尬和人們的喜悅互相對峙。

sentences.english: Ah, then we can both help each other.
sentences.chinese: 啊，那麼我們兩人可以互相幫助了。

sentences.english: The Bible is its own expositor. Scripture is to be compared with scripture.
sentences.chinese: 聖經是它自己的解釋者，聖經中的經文要互相做比較。

definition: tacit understanding/mutual understanding/rapport/connected at a deep level with each other/(of team members) well coordinated/tight
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
neither giving way to the other
see 惺惺惜惺惺[xing1 xing1 xi1 xing1 xing1]
